Young Adult

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

King of Scars by Leigh Bardugo

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Apr 4, 2019

King of Scars features a stunning world and story and well-developed characters with realistic relationships.

Find new favourites among these up-and-coming Young Adult authors

Written by Sophie Green · Published Apr 1, 2019

We've put together a list of YA authors we think should be better known for Suffolk Libraries Children's Month.

New Young Adult books for April 2019

Written by Sophie Green · Published Mar 28, 2019

New titles from Alex Wheatle, Alice Broadway and Cassandra Clare

Fierce Fragile Hearts by Sara Barnard

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Mar 28, 2019

Fierce Fragile Hearts is a heartbreaking and utterly beautiful story.

Piglettes by Clémentine Beauvais

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Mar 26, 2019

Piglettes is funny, uplifting and inspiring.

Enchantée by Gita Trelease

Written by Eleanor Easton · Published Mar 19, 2019

Enchantée is a glittering, lush tale of magic and court politics.

Odd One Out by Nic Stone

Written by Lucy French · Published Mar 5, 2019

Odd One Out is a well-written, entertaining, and tender story.

Pick up a stellar title from the YA Book Prize 2019 shortlist

Written by Alice Violett · Published Feb 28, 2019

The YA Book Prize celebrates the books for teenagers and young adults that have been published over the past year.

Whiteout, by Gabriel Dylan

Written by Amy Rush Da Silva · Published Feb 28, 2019

Whiteout has everything you could want in a YA horror.

New Young Adult books for March 2019

Written by Sophie Green · Published Feb 28, 2019

New titles from Tomi Adeyemi, Laura Steven & Teri Terry

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
